Parents, keep your crafty kid learning summer by asking her to create her own board game. Ask your student to think of something she loves - a sport, book or tv character, or animal. Then use this to create a game all her own. From designing the game board to making up the rules, this activity will exercise both her creative side and critical thinking skills. For younger students, help them create a memory game. Ask your student to draw 8 sets of identical pictures. Cut these apart, flip the pieces picture side down, and scramble them up. Your student can practice his memory skills by trying to find the matching image sets.

#TipTuesday
